text: Setting a lambda function as a property

code:
class Test(int):
    difference = property(lambda self: self.__sub__)

class Test2(int):
    difference=lambda self: self.__sub__

text: Is there any difference between these two classes?
New: If so, what is the purpose of using the property to store a lambda function that returns another function?

childList.text: to store a lambda function that returns another function

text: Update: Changed the question to what I should have asked in the first place.
